<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Come on, <MYNAME> dear. Up and at 'em!
Morning's here!

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Good morning, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You said you didn't sleep too well the night
before last. Did you sleep a little better last
night?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Wonderful! I'm glad to hear it.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Today, I think I'll teach you a little about trading.
<PAGE>
There's a <GREEN>Trade Depot</GREEN> on the outskirts of town.
Let's head on over there.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Miss Veronica oversees all of the trading that
happens in town.
<PAGE>
I'm sure she can do a far better job of explaining
it than I could, so I've asked her to help.
<PAGE>
I'll be waiting right here for you whenever you're
done.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Yes, Madam Eda requested that I instruct you.
<PAGE>
So today, I'll give you an introductory lecture on
trading. I'm afraid it may be a touch long-
winded, but bear with me.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
First, let me tell you about our marketplace.
<PAGE>
This is the <GREEN>Trade Depot</GREEN>. Merchants from foreign
countries come here to trade with this region.
<PAGE>
They bring all kinds of things to sell, from
foreign crop seeds to exotic livestock.
<PAGE>
In other words, you can find many items here
that you'd never find elsewhere.
<PAGE>
Similarly, farmers earn money by <RED>shipping</RED> their
crops and products to the merchants.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>In this way, both the town and the merchants
help each other make a living.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
The exchange of crops and products between
towns and countries in this way is what we
know as <RED>trade</RED>.
<PAGE>
Now, allow me to explain the details of
conducting trade. Good, it looks like our
merchant has just arrived.
<NAME_VERONICA>Good morning, Asche.

<NAME_MOB_ASHE>
Ah, Miss Veronica! Good morning.

<NAME_VERONICA>I'm glad you were able to come today, even on
your day off.

<NAME_MOB_ASHE>
Not a problem! You always help the trade flow
so smoothly here, after all. Now, is this your
student of the day?

<NAME_VERONICA>Indeed. Allow me to introduce you.
<PAGE>
This is <MYNAME>, the new farmer who just
recently moved here.

<NAME_MOB_ASHE>
A pleasure to meet you, <MYNAME>!
<PAGE>
I'm <BLUE>Asche</BLUE>, a merchant from the <BLUE>Silk Country</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
I look forward to doing business with you.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now then, allow me to explain how to use the
stalls.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
When a merchant comes to town, they will set
up a stall here in the Trade Depot's court.

If you stand across the counter from them, like
this, and <BLUE>press the A Button</BLUE> to talk, they will
show you their wares.

Merchants sometimes sell rare items found only
in their home countries in their stalls.
<PAGE>
Only Asche is here today, but as more countries
come to trade, you'll find more special items to
buy.

Also, when you'd like to <RED>ship</RED> the products of
your own farm, you can do so at these stalls.

<NAME_MOB_ASHE>
Please do! The more you ship, the more trade
between our countries flourishes.
<PAGE>
And when trade flourishes, we'll both be in a
pretty good position.

<NAME_MOB_ASHE>
I'm only stopping by today, but I'll be wheeling
and dealing all day tomorrow. Come on by if
you're interested.
<PAGE>
I'll be open from <BLUE>9:00 to 21:00</BLUE>.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Thank you for your assistance, Asche.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Today, Asche came by as a special favor to me,
but normally, she has set days she's open for
business.
<PAGE>
<RED>On the days when merchants aren't in town, you
won't be able to buy from them or ship to them<RED>,
so plan accordingly.
<PAGE>
Now, <MYNAME>, if you'll follow me to the
entrance, please.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is Mr. <BLUE>Jonas</BLUE>. He's a guild member who I've
asked to oversee the operation of the Trade
Depot.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hello there, <MYNAME>.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
If you ask him, Mr. Jonas will tell you all about
what's happening with the market.
<PAGE>
For example, have a look at this.

This is the Trading Information Board.

It lists which countries are operating a stall, and
which goods they're willing to buy for higher
than the usual rates.

Allow me to elaborate on that.

First, the countries present.

As more countries come to trade, their names
will be added to the board.
<PAGE>
The names will be listed in white if a merchant
from that country is currently operating a stall
at the Trade Depot.

Conversely, if no one is present, the country's
name will be displayed in gray.

Next, let me tell you about <RED>recommended
goods</RED>.

Goods listed as "recommended" are currently in
demand in a particular country, so you can ship
them for a higher price.
<PAGE>
Recommended goods will be displayed by
category, such as <RED>Flowers</RED> or <RED>Wines</RED>, like this.

Each country will have different recommended
goods. If you have what they want, it's in your
interest to ship to them.
<PAGE>
However, countries' needs change over time, so
specific recommendations won't last forever.

Outside of the time period listed here, the price
for those goods will return to normal.

Recommended goods change regularly, so pay
close attention to discover opportunities for
profit.
<PAGE>
You can check the timeframe for recommended
goods any time by asking Mr. Jonas, and I
advise you to do so often.

<FACE_JONAS><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
You can also check that there board; it lists days
when merchants will be having sales. But feel
free to ask me any questions you have.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I will send you some literature which goes into
more detail on trading. You can find it on your
bookshelf if any of this slips your mind.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, shall we go find Madam Eda?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Ah, <MYNAME>. Well done, dear.
<PAGE>
Do you understand a little more about trading
now? Shipping, in particular, is very important.
You'll have a chance to try it yourself someday.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, let's head home.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is the Trade Depot, where merchants come
to buy and sell. It doesn't look like any are here
now, though.
<PAGE>
But when they do come, it can get pretty lively
here!
<PAGE>
Let's go in.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Good morning, Madam Eda, <MYNAME>. I've
been waiting for you.
<BLUE>Trading</BLUE> was added to your bookshelf.
<BLUE>About Sales</BLUE> was added to your bookshelf.
<BLUE>About Rates</BLUE> was added to your bookshelf.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now then, if you don't mind, I must excuse
myself.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Thank you, Miss Veronica. I'll see you later.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
You're welcome, Madam Eda. Please continue to
instruct <MYNAME> for just a little longer.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL><MYNAME>, should you ever have any
problems, do not hesitate to ask, okay?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well then, let's head home.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Ah, home sweet home. It's been such a long
time since I went to the Trade Depot that I've
tuckered myself right out.
<PAGE>
I'm sure you must be exhausted too, dear.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
For now, why don't you rest up so you'll be
ready for a full day of work tomorrow?
<PAGE>
Here you go, your allowance for today. You did
well.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Oh! Don't forget to write in your journal before
you go to sleep.
<PAGE>
Good night.
Received 500G.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
(no translation)
